quote: Wisdom, humility, caution, moderation, justice, mercy, discretion, constancy, benevolence, chastity and temperance. With these anchors you should fix in God the cable so that it will hold the ship of your mind.
author: St. Augustine’s Soliloquies

quote:
'You know, all the problems in my life, just a story I've created.'
 'Hm, yeah.'
author: The Good Journey (2018)

quote:
The most important part is you take action and start doing whatever is in front of you.
 I take a step forward, and stuff starts running at me.
author: Unemployed to Jr. Software Developer at 45 (YouTube)

quote: Natural stresses shape people into functioning human beings; man-made stresses served to weaken a man and make him ill. One resembles strength; the other resembles weakness.
author: unknown

quote: As you start to walk on the way, the way appears.
author: alal ad-Din Rumi

quote: It takes only 6 months of pure dedication to change your life.
author: Moral Philosophy Twitter

quote:
The best way to grow without pressure is to grow in solitude.
 Away from the eyes of everyone and at your own pace.
author: Wealth by reading Twitter

quote: Perfect is the enemy of good.
author: Voltaire

quote: Speech is of Time, Silence is of Eternity.
author: Sartor Resartus, 1831

quote: Rise but seldom—let this be on important matters—and then make yourself thoroughly acquainted with the subject.
author: George Washington

quote: Never be agitated by more than a decent warmth, & offer your sentiments with modest diffidence.
author: George Washington

quote: Procrastination is really a self-inflicted wound that gradually chips away at the most valuable resource in the world: time.
author: Eric Jaffe

quote: The best personal remedy for procrastination might actually be self-forgiveness.
author: Eric Jaffe

quote: Let me die in the country that I love the most ...
author: Colter Wall, Plain-to-see Plainsman

quote: Of course it's the same old story. Truth usually is the same old story.
author: Margaret Thatcher
